glsa.title: D-Bus, GLib: Privilege escalation
glsa.synopsis: A vulnerability has been found in D-Bus which allows local attackers to gain escalated privileges.

background.p: D-Bus is a daemon providing a framework for applications to communicate with one another. GLib is a library providing a number of GNOMEâ€™s core objects and functions.

description.p: When libdbus is used in a setuid program, a user can gain escalated privileges by leveraging the DBUS_SYSTEM_BUS_ADDRESS variable. GLib can be used in a setuid context with D-Bus, and so can trigger this vulnerability. Please review the CVE identifier below for more details.

impact.p: A local attacker could gain escalated privileges and execute arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
